instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02100: What is 820-02100? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
hello,

this board came in for liquid mainly on the trackpad connector / battery.. PPBUS was shorted to ground until I removed the trackpad connector on MLB and it was gone.. I noticed that the backlight IC had minor corrosions around it.. I ordered a bunch of ICs online and replaced it.. 

the computer switches to 20V and shows Apple logo (no BL) and shuts off then restarts and does the whole thing again; 5V > 20V > Apple logo > restart

No voltage on PPVOUT LUXE 

PPBUS is there 
PPBUS LUXE is there 
3v8 AON is there 
BL PWR EN is there 
5V S2 is there

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Test it disconnecting internal LCD assembly.
Use external monitor...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Yeah disconnecting the internal LCD it gives an image normally to an external monitor.. 

note: lid angle sensor is clean

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Did you test with known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
Check all traces and components in backlight area.
There should be something affected by corrosion.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message: Is there are any major mandatory rails prior to backlight that need to be present that i must look up? Please enlighten me

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02100</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight
threads.message:
UP800 requires <SIGNAL>BL_PWR_EN_R</SIGNAL> and correct communication through <SIGNAL>SPMI_DISP_BKLT_CLK</SIGNAL>/DATA bus.
All QP800-03 and adjacent components and traces must be good too.
<SIGNAL>5V_S2</SIGNAL> must also arrive to UP800 and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> to QP800.

Check if UP701/30 deliver correct voltage.
